WorkItem.ClosedComment:
Hi,

I am closing this work item as this feature is now supported in the Prism guidance. For more information about this you can check Chapter 10: Deploying Prism Applications (http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg430856%28v=PandP.40%29.aspx) of the Prism documentation. For additional support regarding this subject you could create a thread in the discussions section, where we will help you with your concerns.

Regards,

Damian Cherubini
http://blogs.southworks.net/dcherubini
WorkItem.Description:
Hi there,
I tried to deploy a simple CAL-Application inside of Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 using ClickOnce. After deployment and succesful starting the program I tried to compile my application again. Now the following error occurs:
 
Resolution of the dependency failed, type = "Microsoft.Practices.ServiceLocation.IServiceLocator", name = "". Exception message is: The current build operation (build key Build Key[Microsoft.Practices.Composite.UnityExtensions.UnityServiceLocatorAdapter, null]) failed: ReadOnlyPermissionSet objects may not be modified. (Strategy type BuildPlanStrategy, index 3)
 
I tried with another CAL-Application and got the same error after . Any ideas? Maybe it's because of Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1 ?!
 
Cheers,
 Joe
WorkItem.Summary: Using ClickOnce with CAL Feb 09 and Visual Studio 2010 Beta 1

Comments.Message:
Hi Joe,

It could be useful to know that, as of Prism v4, it's possible to deploy Prism applications using ClickOnce. We've deployed the HelloWorld QuickStart with ClickOnce and found no issues whatsoever.

Thank you for your feedback.

Guido Leandro Maliandi
http://blogs.southworks.net/gmaliandi
